group.label: Shipment Defaults
group.comment: These settings will be used for automatic shipping label creation. If a label cannot be created with your configured defaults, the order must be processed manually. Use the DHL Label Status Column in the Order list to identify those orders.

field.label: Print Only If Codeable
field.comment: If enabled, shipment orders will only return a label if the DHL delivery address verification succeeds.

field.label: Sender Address Book Reference
field.comment: Reference an entry from your DHL Business Customer Portal address book. If left blank, the origin address configured in Shipping Settings will be used. Using an entry from the DHL sender address book allows to print your logo on the label. This setting is ignored in sandbox mode.

field.label: Send Receiver Phone Number
field.comment: If enabled, the consignee's phone number will be forwarded to DHL on international shipments.

field.label: Shipping Products
field.comment: Selected products will be pre-selected for automatic shipping label creation. You can still select another product when creating shipping labels manually.
field.tooltip: Select "Merchandise Shipment" only if you ship all or most of your orders as Merchandise Shipments. Otherwise, choose "DHL Paket".

field.label: Customs Reference Numbers
field.comment: A sender's reference number can be configured per destination country. It is used by customs authorities to identify economics operators an/or other persons involved.

field.label: Electronic Export Notification
field.comment: If enabled, DHL will be notified that an electronic export declaration was completed by the merchant and that an Export Accompanying Document (EAD) is attached to the parcel. See also Customs Information.

group.comment: Here you can define default values for additional shipping services. Please note that selected options are only applied if they are valid for the given order. Incompatible services, e.g. domestic-only services for a cross-border order, will be omitted when booking a shipping label.
group.label: Additional Services

field.label: Use Visual Check of Age Service
field.comment: If enabled, the visual age check service will be booked during shipment orders.

field.label: Use Named Person Only Service
field.comment: If enabled, DHL will hand over the parcel only to the recipient or to an authorized person.

field.label: Use No Neighbour Delivery Service
field.comment: If enabled, DHL will not attempt to make delivery to a neighbor. If the customer is not available, then the parcel will be delivered to a retail outlet or locker instead.

field.label: Use Retail Outlet Routing Service
field.comment: If enabled, your undeliverable packages will be held at the nearest parcel collection point for collection by the recipient rather than being returned immediately to you.

field.label: Alternative Email Address
field.comment: Non-delivery notice will be sent to this email address. If left empty, the customer's email address is used. In this case, you must make sure to obtain data privacy consent from your customers.
field.tooltip: Enter your email address here if you, as the sender, would like to receive the collection information.

field.label: Use Additional Insurance Service
field.comment: If enabled, shipments will be insured with higher than standard amount.

field.label: Use Bulky Goods Service
field.comment: If enabled, shipments will be marked as bulk freight.

field.label: Use Premium Service
field.comment: On routes that require the Premium service, it will be booked implicitly regardless of this setting.

field.label: Non-delivery Instruction
field.comment: Select how to treat international parcels that cannot be delivered. They can either be abandoned (free of charge) or returned to the sender.

field.label: Use Return Shipment Service
field.comment: If enabled, a return shipment label will be requested from the webservice. A return address other than the Shipping Origin can be configured below.
